node.title: 'I felt like a prisoner': Here's what it's like to live under a conservatorship like Britney Spears
node.alt: A man holds a smiling young girl in his arms
node.description: Jenny Hatch is among more than a million Americans who've lived under strict legal arrangements where their every move was controlled by someone else. Now that the Britney Spears case has shone the spotlight on conservatorships, advocates are pushing for change.
node.content:
["Nick Clouse wouldn't really describe himself as a Britney Spears fan, but he knows more than most what the past 13 years of her life might have felt like.", "Until this year, he was one of an estimated 1.3 million Americans living under guardianship \u2014 also referred to in some cases as conservatorship.", "Depending on the terms of the agreement, a guardian can wield enormous power.", "They can control and sell assets belonging to those under guardianship, decide whether or not they can get married, divorced\u00a0or see their children, admit them to an institution and control their health care.", "Advocates for reform describe the situation as a kind of legal Wild West.\u00a0", "In many cases there is little oversight, no qualification required for the job of guardian and no clear legal pathway\u00a0for terminating the arrangement.", "This week, a Los Angeles court ruled to end the conservatorship that has governed Britney Spears's life\u00a0since 2008.", "Like many others, the singer was forced to go through an immense legal battle to regain control over her financial and personal affairs. \u00a0", "", "
Fans of Britney Spears began advocating for her conservatorship to be ended several years ago.\u00a0(ABC News: Bradley McLennan\u00a0)
", "
Working full time, but not allowed to buy nappies without permission
", "On August 24, Mr Clouse was released from the guardianship that had ruled his life for the past 10 years.", "He says comparing that time to his life now is \"like night and day\".", "", "
To celebrate the end of his guardianship, the Clouses threw a party, complete with a Free Britney-themed cake.(Supplied: Nick Clouse\u00a0)
", "The guardianship was put in place by Mr Clouse's parents after a car crash in 2011 when he was on his way to a friend's place to play video games.", "The\u00a0accident left him with a traumatic brain injury, and resulted in a personal injury payout.\u00a0", "Mr Clouse said that, initially, he did need a lot of support with schooling and managing his finances.", "\"I had a tutor [who]\u00a0helped me go back through, like, elementary and middle school, math, English, science, just to get me caught up,\" he said.", "\"I was terrible with money. I had no sense of savings.\"", "He says\u00a0it was fear that he could be taken advantage of that led his parents to impose the guardianship in the first place.", "But it meant he had to ask permission to access money for everyday purchases, such as\u00a0petrol for his car, and left him feeling \"pretty worthless\".", "", "
Mr Clouse's parents remained in control of his finances and decisions even after he married Chelsi.\u00a0(Supplied: Nick Clouse)
", "Things changed when he met his now-wife Chelsi. They welcomed a daughter, Aria, four years ago.\u00a0", "\"I honestly think it was the best thing for me. And, since she's been born, I've done everything I can in my power to make sure she has a good life,\" Mr Clouse said.", "But the guardianship remained.\u00a0Mr Clouse was gainfully employed, first as biotechnician, and now working overnights driving a forklift.", "Yet, as he told a recent Senate hearing entitled Toxic Conservatorships, providing for his young family under the guardianship proved almost impossible.\u00a0", "\"I had no control over my pay cheques I earned and had to get permission from my stepfather to buy diapers and formula for my daughter,\" he said.", "", "
Nick Clouse says\u00a0he had to ask his parents for permission to buy his\u00a0daughter's nappies.\u00a0(Supplied: Nick Clouse\u00a0)
", "
'No question' many more don't really need guardians
", "Justin Schrock, a lawyer with Indiana Disability Rights, eventually helped Mr Clouse get out of his guardianship.", "\"It definitely seemed odd, that someone who was married, had a child at home \u2026 had been working in these highly skilled fields for several years, was under guardianship and didn't have the right to make basic decisions about his life,\" Mr Schrock said.", "Although elements of the case struck Mr Schrock\u00a0as unusual, they were by no means unique.", "\"There's no question, there are many, many more out there who definitely don't need guardians, but who do have them,\" he said.", "One of the most shocking statements to come out of Britney Spears's emotional testimony to a Los Angeles court in June was that she wasn't allowed to get her contraceptive device removed so she could try to fall pregnant.", "\"I wish I could say that it was surprising, but no,\" Mr Schrock said.", "\"Under the guardianship codes of most states, guardians do have that power to really consent to any medical procedures that they want for the individual under guardianship.\"", "
From Free Britney to Free The People
", "", "
Britney Spears has spent more than 13 years under a conservatorship that\u00a0has been\u00a0presided over by her father, Jamie.\u00a0(Reuters)
", "The Britney Spears case started gaining traction on social media in 2020 thanks, in part, to the efforts of a group of fans known as the Free Britney movement.", "Attention reached a fever pitch when a\u00a0series of documentaries were released this year.\u00a0", "Now that Spears is free, some of those fans have teamed up with disability rights advocates to raise awareness of the many ordinary Americans who are under guardianships.", "\"We ain't done. And we ain't going anywhere until Free Britney becomes Free the People,\" disability rights campaigner and lawyer Jonathan Martinis told a small gathering of the Free Britney movement near the White House in October.", "", "
The Free Britney movement has vowed to fight for other Americans who feel unreasonably constrained by their guardianships.\u00a0(ABC News: Bradley McLennan\u00a0)
", "Mr Martinis argues stripping away all the rights of a person with disabilities simply because they need help with some aspects of their life is inherently ableist.", "He advocates for an alternative to guardianships known as supported decision-making.\u00a0", "\"The most important question we can ask before putting someone in guardianship is, 'What else have you tried',\" he said.", "Jenny Hatch, one of Mr Martinis's clients, has become something of a trailblazer for supported decision-making.", "Ms Hatch has Down syndrome and found herself living in a group home in Virginia under a guardianship hastily arranged by her parents after a bike accident in 2012.", "", "
Jenny Hatch said she was placed in a group home as part of a guardianship arrangement.\u00a0(ABC News: Bradley McLennan\u00a0)
", "Mr Martinis said her case showed just how easily guardianships could be imposed.", "\"Jenny walked into a tiny courtroom in Newport News, Virginia \u2026 with all her rights,\" he said.", "\"She had the right to do everything that you do. Three hours later, she walked out with nothing.\"", "Ms Hatch, now 38, said she hated the group home.", "\"It's a terrible place,\" she said.", "\"I wasn't allowed to see my friends, I wasn't allowed to use my cell phone and my computer.\"", "Ms Hatch wasn't even allowed to see her lawyer freely.", "\"If you wanted to see or speak with Jenny, you had to fill in a permission slip,\" Mr Martinis said.", "\"And you had to agree to the rules of visitation. Rule number one: 'You're not allowed to talk to her about the guardianship, because it upsets her.'", "\"You know why it upset her? She didn't want to be in guardianship.\"", "After a year of litigation, the guardianship was terminated in 2013.", "Ms Hatch moved in with friends and began working again at a thrift store.", "", "
Jenny Hatch says she's now happy to have regained control over her life.(ABC News: Bradley McLennan)
", "\"I get my life back,\" she told the ABC.", "\"And I got my rights. I can vote again. And I can go to church again.\"", "Ms Hatch would like to see law reforms to ensure others don't go through what she did.", "\"Just because people have a disability, doesn't mean they need a guardianship,\" she said.", "\"Many times they may need just a little help.\""]
